title: 2012-02-humanities-student-major_578_funny.txt
content_scrubbed:
***Bejelewed*** (2002)

This particular depiction has long been held as the most humanistic of S. W.[.] work. It incorporates a multitude of themes which characterize the plagues of our era, which are not limited to:

* *missing the bus*, as we see an intentionally and masterfully motion-blurred vintage 1955 Ford Motorized Catapillarham exiting left, against the direction of our eyes' natural right-dominant reading direction as dictated by da Vinci,

* *playing Bejeweled until one[.] eyes bleed*, which for years both prior and since the generation of the piece has reduced the overall workmanship in international flourescent-lit offices (though the trend has still been found to reduce suicide rates in cubical centers established highrise buildings),

* *airbourne particulate pollution plaught*, a phenomenon which was first observed in 1989 in Portland, Oregon as a sophistocratic alternative to lesser pollution schema locally referred to as *smog'n'grog*,

* and finally, *the rule of thirds* which has contrained the creative potential of dual psycholog/photography majors in liberal_arts colleges nationally for over a decade, and has been dismissed as an expectation which, in utility, was recently found in a gallup poll to waver between "kinda cool" and "really, super-gay, bro".

*Bejeweled* is usually held to be a representational piece and likely was not based on any real-world counterpart outside of the artist[.] own imagination. Perhaps it is because of this that the work has gained a cult following among upper-middle class youths. The work is frequently likened to the erotica graphic novel *Dharma Bums*.
